definition: special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex
to print/to publish/publication/periodical/to peel with a knife/to carve/to amend

sentences.english: Special invitation letters and direct mail, exhibitions regularly informed of progress.
sentences.chinese: 特刊與邀請函直郵，定期通報展覽會的進展。

sentences.english: This blog post is part of a special National Geographic News series on global water issues.
sentences.chinese: 此博客節選自國家地理新聞系列特刊的全球水話題。

sentences.english: The special double-issue of People hits news stands on Friday.
sentences.chinese: 《人物》雜誌本期特刊將於本週五上架。

sentences.english: All information about the lectures will also be released through on-line special coverage or special editions.
sentences.chinese: 講堂內容將以網絡專題或特刊形式發佈。

sentences.english: The newsboy gave me an extra special edition.
sentences.chinese: 報童又給了我一份特刊。

sentences.english: All information about the forums will also be publicized through on-line special coverage or special editions.
sentences.chinese: 論壇內容將以網絡專題或特刊形式發佈。

definition: to start publishing/to found a journal
old variant of 刊[kan1]/to peel with a knife/to carve/to amend
to carry a story/to publish (in a newspaper or magazine)
